{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia (PEH) is a benign condition that closely simulates squamous cell carcinoma, but it is not squamous cell carcinoma itself, so option A is incorrect. Similarly, it is not basal cell carcinoma or verrucous carcinoma, so options B and C are also incorrect. According to Document 1, pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia was determined in a case of myoblastoma, so option D is the correct answer.", "answer_choice": "D"}
